page.title: 14GOLDEN SQUARE
page.content: Central to the re-vitalising of the town centre has been the Â£23 million golden square development.Shops are at ground level with goods delivery and other servicing at the basement.Malls provide under-cover and traffic-free access to the shops and department stores.This area is linked by a covered bridge to a large multi-storey car park.The Golden Square is built around the old Market place and the Barley Mow, an ancient public house dating from around 1560. This retains the character of the old town together with the shops on the western side which are built in the style of buildings previously on the site. The central square is covered by the old Fishmarket in delicate wrought iron. A sculpture of the Mad Hatter's Tea Party was recently unveiled by the Prince and Princess of Wales.
